column4: hello, someone knows a tool to decrypt files (specifically images) or any known method how to do it?
it depends on what program your file was originally encrypted.
thats the point, i don't know with wich program was encrypted
what extention name is followed by your filename?
wait, let me check
its JPG
can you be sure the JPG has been encrypted? If the file is downloaded, chances are it is broken, you are not able to open it either.
yeah, im sure, but i think the file its a leter broken too
anyway, can i fix it or decrypt ?
if the file is broken after it got encrypted, chances are you may not be able to decrypt it. try to use 'gpg' to verify what algorithm it was used, if the file indeed has been encrypted.
what gpg means?
its an aplication?
'gpg' is a common tool for encryption/decryption purposes and it is included in almost all linux ditributions. open your terminal and type: gpg --version

the file is either broken or encrypted and wrapped by a specific program.
